I’m currently learning how to use the path planner with Swerve, but the robot doesn’t follow the created path and starts to spin.
How i can solve it?

https://github.com/BlackCold4948/Swerve_ElevPD

this is the code why i using in the swerve.

Im not sure if this is the entire issue, but might explain part of it. Your yagsl configuration says the module positions are ± 22.75 inches. This suggests that your robot is 45.5 inches wide, which I slightly doubt. The correct configuration is from the dead center of the robot to the modules, so the correct unsigned value for the module positions would be half of 22.75, assuming your frame is 22.75 inches wide and a square. Although if it is 45.5 inches, I apologize.

The google drive is also not open to public and requires access to be requested. Not sure if that was what you intended.

My team had a similar issue a while ago on our old robot. This was due to the robot’s angle drifting slightly out of alignment. When the PID tried to correct it, it sent it the wrong way causing the error to increase which made the robot spin out of control.
We fixed it by negating the angle value of the chassis speeds object Pathplanner sends to our Swerve subsystem by adding this line of code in our setChassisSpeeds method:
chassisSpeeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond *= -1;
